channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Most distant supernova: James Webb sees a star explode at cosmic dawn
item.description: Scientists have detected the most distant supernova ever seen, exploding when the universe was less than a billion years old. The event was first sign...

item.title: The deep ocean has a missing link and scientists finally found it
item.description: Scientists have uncovered why big predators like sharks spend so much time in the ocean’s twilight zone. The answer lies with mid-sized fish such as t...

item.title: Mini brains reveal clear brain signals of schizophrenia and bipolar disorder
item.description: Tiny lab-grown brains are offering an unprecedented look at how schizophrenia and bipolar disorder disrupt neural activity. Researchers found distinct...

item.title: Ancient wolves could only have reached this island by boat
item.description: Scientists have uncovered ancient wolf remains on a small Baltic island where wolves could only have been brought by humans. These animals weren’t dog...

item.title: Mars dust storms are crackling with electricity
item.description: Mars isn’t just dusty—it crackles with electricity. Scientists discovered that dust devils can generate tiny electric sparks, captured for the first t...
